snippet: The accounting charge will contribute to a loss of $4.31 to $4.49 a share when Hewlett-Packard announces its third-quarter results, the company said.
abstract: Hewlett-Packard will take an $8 billion accounting charge related to its 2008 acquisition of Electronic Data Systems, and an additional charge of $1.5 billion to $1.7 billion related to recent layoffs; charges will contribute to a loss of $4.31 to $4.49 a share when firm announces its third-quarter results.
lead_paragraph: The accounting charge will contribute to a loss of $4.31 to $4.49 a share when Hewlett-Packard announces its third-quarter results, the company said.

headline.seo: H.P. Takes $8 Billion Charge for E.D.S. and Post Loss
headline.main: H.P. Takes $8 Billion Charge on E.D.S. Acquisition
headline.print_headline: Hewlett to Take $8 Billion Charge For E.D.S. and Post 3rd-Quarter Loss
